results.title: Generations
results.brief_description: A non-narrated treatment of the interaction that occurs between a young boy and an elderly couple in a park. Useful for generationg discussion with Years 4-6 about stereotyped attitudes towards old age.

results.title: Generation.net 2000: taking IT to the limit
results.brief_description: An amalgam of rapid images backed by a pulsing techno beat promoting the IT industry, the people in it and the people who use it. “Create, design, build, change, dream” is the catch cry as words such as evolution, global, internet, music, fashion, film and TV flash across the screen. Ends with Josh Simmonds (animator) and Sally McManus (sound engineer) presenting a brief profile of what they do and why they do it.

results.title: Generation on the wind
results.creator_credit: Windmill Movie Company, Joel Silverman, Samanther Shadd and David A. Vassar
results.brief_description: Details the year long construction of a wind generator on the small island of Cutty Hunk off the New England coast by a group of men who apply collective skills to a task new to all of them.

results.title: Generation of electricity
results.brief_description: Opens with a survey of the uses of electricity in everyday life. A simple laboratory experiment with magnet, solenoid and galvanometer is used to demonstrate the principles of electricity generation. Diagrams explain the operations of rotating coil and rotating magnet types of generators. The latter part of the film shows how water power is used to turn the turbines of generators used in power stations.

results.title: Generation
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, British Council and Ruth Carr
results.brief_description: This documentary film is about four young teenagers who live in and around Manchester, England. It’s about their lives, their dreams, their aspirations, their alienation, their boredom, their hopelessness and their Saturday nights. Best friends, Fiona Ball and Gaynor McNulty (both aged 17) live in a small village about 40 minutes North East of Manchester. Clubbing for them is the ultimate ritual and the perfect antidote for surviving life in a small town. John McDonald (aged 15) lives on a housing estate in Stockport with his sister (aged 27) and her two young boys. For all of his tough exterior, John is extremely vulnerable and weighed down by feelings of uncertainty and apathy regarding his own future. Hussein Al-Allak (aged 15) lives alone with his mum on a housing estate in suburban Chorlton-Cum-Hardy. In contrast to John, Hussein has a sense of hope and excitement about his future. From these four stories is woven an evocative tableau of life in a northern English city. Includes information sheet. (Awards: Includes Chicago Film Festival, 1997; British Short Film Festival, 1997)

results.title: Generalisation, discrimination and motivation (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Behaviour Theory in Practice”.
Stresses methods of conditioning by reinforcing operant behaviour. Demonstrates motivation by positive reinforcement, conditioning reinforcement, punishment, negative reinforcement, avoidance and control self-simulation, in laboratory experiments and other learning situations. Compares the efficacy of praise and other positive reinforcements to punishment and negative reinforcements.

results.title: General wharf safety
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and New Zealand. Marine Dept
results.brief_description: The simple precautions that can save serious accidents on the waterfront. Watching wharf traffic; using gangways and not planks; keeping hatch covers, gear and dunnage stacked neatly out of the way; walking on the off side of an overhead crane; reporting damage promptly; working in good light; keeping guard rails and ropes around open hatches and holds.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit and New Zealand. Marine Dept

results.title: General principles
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Brian Hannant, South Australian Film Corporation and Slater Sound Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into some of the specific exercises and conditioning techniques necessary for the athlete to achieve his best. Illustrates various sports with particular emphasis on track and field events.

results.title: General music program
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, F Whitman Trecartin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Halifax Music is a documentary on the teaching methods of the Music Department of the Halifax School Board. Many of the basic concepts originated with the Hungarian composer Kodaly. Musical education is continuous from the primary grades through to Grade XII. The film tours the various classrooms, demonstrating methods and results, and shows how learning and enjoyment go hand in hand.
